title: US Govt. Makes $8.9B Investment in Intel Stock
description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Former Kansas City Fed President, Esther George, discusses whether or not when the Federal Reserve decides to cut rates will it risk Fed credibility. Dominic LeBlanc, president of the King's Privy Council for Canada and minister for Canada-US trade, explains why Canada is removing its retaliatory tariffs on a long list of US products that comply with the existing North American trade deal. Evelyn Farkas, former Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Russia, Ukraine, & Eurasia shares her thoughts on how much leverage President Trump has in stopping the war in Ukraine. (Source: Bloomberg)

summary: The US government has made an investment of $8.9B in Intel Stock, with the company agreeing to give the government a 10% equity stake. The investment comes after the company agreed to give its customers a lower rate of interest. Federal Reserve Chairman, Jay POWELL, discussed the shift in policy stance following recent data and suggested that it might be time to cut interest rates. The company has also agreed to share a 50% equity stake with the US government. The potential impact on the economy is uncertain as a result of the weak economy and potential for inflation.
shortSummary: The US government makes an $8.9B investment in Intel, amid concerns over economic instability and potential market volatility, with potential for interest rate cuts.
argos_summary: Bloomberg’s "Balance of Power" covered a wide range of political and economic stories, including Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s hints at possible rate cuts amid a cautious labor market, President Trump’s controversial 10% stake in Intel and his trade actions with Canada and tariffs on China. The show also discussed Trump’s pressure on Fed Governor Lisa Cook, the U.S. stance on the Ukraine war and potential sanctions, and the federal judge’s order to dismantle a Florida detention camp. Additional segments addressed AI regulation, Nvidia’s chip sales to China, and the FBI raid on former national security adviser John Bolton, highlighting the administration’s aggressive domestic and foreign policy moves.
